Video is really good but there seems to be something wrong with the audio. Tried watching this with my TV and few different video players but the speech is really quiet and all other sounds are loud. Its horrible trying to figure out some parts what people are trying to say and then suddenly music comes on loud as fuck. Going to try the 480p instead..

@lontrus.... 1280*720 would be in the ratio of 16:9, since the movies is at an aspect ratio of 2.35:1 it has only 544 vertical lines of picture and black bars make up the other 176 lines of resolution. Meaning you still get the same picture quality. Just for future reference!
z

@lontrus.. 1280*720p is movies that are filmed at a 16:9 aspect ratio. Since this movie is 2.35:1 the movie has 544 vertical lines of picture and the other 176 lines are made up of the black bars top and bottom. Which means you get 720p picture quality. Just for future reference!

@ brandon_monkey. Don't expect a reply from lontrus, he is scratching his head an trying to figure out the math. Someone should come out with rips aimed at people like that, "true" 1280x720 rips...with 176 lines of black nothing permanently encoded in.

@lontrus, i am just tired of seeing comments like yours & other sick fucks like you, you guys are so horrible you think that you know everything but the truth is the opposite, you guys are half witted dumb assholes. If you have so much of problem, go buy the fucking bluray disc, fucking moron.

@rulssi - I had the same problem too with the audio, the voices being far too quiet to hear but the music being loud on VLC media player. I thought it was odd for a trusted host to upload a dodgy file, but it does work with the right media player. Try Divx Plus Player, the audio worked fine with that program.
@ rulssi - Try Divx Plus Player and the audio will work fine.
